page.title: 04Churches in the Area
page.content: St. Nicholas church is the parish church of North Bradley.There has been a church on the site for atleast 500 year. The church was rebuilt in 1863, because it was falling down. By the door is a font that is 500 years old.It is made of stone.Some of the stone there are carvings in symbols of oppostles, it tells stories in pictures. The first vicar was William de Avening he did his services in Latin. The chapel ceiling is a carved oak ceiling.In the chapel is a tomb with lady Emma Stafford in it. She is the mother of the Bishop of Canterbury.She was buried in 1456. The pulpit was originally here in 1863,but the panels are Jacobean. the prayer desk carved out of oak taken from the roof of the church.the oak is probalbly 200 years old.
